column5: July 20 France's Faurecia SA is set to explore a sale of its bumpers business  which may be worth about $450 million  Bloomberg reported on Monday  citing sources.

column5: HOUSTON  July 20 A section of a key Gulf Coast waterway was shut after two barges collided Monday  setting one afire and possibly spilling a gasoline additive near the entrance to the Houston Ship Channel  the U.S. Coast Guard said.

column4: Lockheed expects positive Pentagon view on Sikorsky buy

column4: UPDATE 1-Lockheed expects positive Pentagon view on Sikorsky buy

column4: Lockheed sees U.S. Marines 'on track' to declare F-35 combat-ready
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp Chief Executive Marillyn Hewson on Monday said the U.S. Marine Corps was "on track" to declare an initial squadron of F-35B fighter jets ready for combat this month after completing a review of the squadron last week.

column4: Lockheed says commercial cyber business part of strategic review
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp is including its commercial cyber business in a strategic review of key services and information technology businesses  but will not exit the government cybersecurity business  Chief Executive Marillyn Hewson said.

column4: Lockheed CFO sees Sikorsky turnaround around late 2018 or 2019
column5: WASHINGTON Sikorsky Aircraft will face some revenues and earnings pressures for several years  but should see improved market conditions in the commercial sector and growth in new military production around late 2018 or 2019  Lockheed Martin Corp's chief financial officer said on Monday.

column4: Morgan Stanley profit falls on compensation costs  tax provision
column5: July 20 Morgan Stanley reported an 8.5 percent fall in quarterly profit  hurt by a rise in compensation costs and as the sixth-largest U.S. bank by assets set aside more money to cover taxes.

column4: UPDATE 2-Pearson exploring sale of Financial Times -Bloomberg
Pearson exploring sale of Financial Times: Bloomberg
column5: LONDON British publisher Pearson  is exploring the sale of its  Financial Times newspaper after receiving interest from potential buyers  Bloomberg reported on Monday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 1-Brazil convicts first construction executives in Petrobras scandal
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  July 20 Three executives of Brazil's Camargo Correa group were convicted on Monday of money laundering  corruption and other charges  the first construction-industry executives to be sentenced in a giant price fixing and bribery scandal involving state-run oil company Petrobras.

column5: BAKU Norway's Statoil is to sell its 20-percent stake in the  Trans Adriatic Gas Pipeline (TAP) project that will carry gas from Azerbaijan to Europe  the president of Azeri state energy firm SOCAR said.

column4: Taiwan stocks rise; tech heavyweights gain

column4: Blackstone  Corsair clinch $4 billion deal for First Eagle
column5: Private equity firms Blackstone Group LP and Corsair Capital have agreed to acquire a majority stake in First Eagle Investment Management  valuing the company at around $4 billion including debt  First Eagle announced on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Blackstone  Corsair clinch $4 bln deal for First Eagle
column5: July 20 Private equity firms Blackstone Group LP  and Corsair Capital have agreed to acquire a majority stake in First Eagle Investment Management  valuing the company at around $4 billion including debt  First Eagle announced on Monday.

column5: July 20 Private equity firms Blackstone Group LP  and Corsair Capital have agreed to acquire a majority stake in First Eagle Investment Management  valuing the company at around $4 billion including debt  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: Alibaba  Unilever announce partnership to reach Chinese consumers
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Chinese ecommerce company Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd announced on Sunday that it had signed a strategic partnership agreement with Unilever NV to help the consumer products group reach more Chinese shoppers.

column4: Alibaba  Unilever announce partnership to reach Chinese consumers
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  July 19 Chinese ecommerce company Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd announced on Sunday that it had signed a strategic partnership agreement with Unilever NV  to help the consumer products group reach more Chinese shoppers.

column4: Lockheed to buy Black Hawk maker Sikorsky for $9 billion
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp said Monday it would buy Black Hawk maker Sikorsky Aircraft from United Technologies Corp for $9 billion  cementing Lockheed's dominance in weapons making. | Video

column4: Lockheed expects positive Pentagon view on Sikorsky buy
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp on Monday said Pentagon officials planned a detailed review of the company's bid to acquire Sikorsky Aircraft  the helicopter unit of United Technologies Corp  but it did not expect major obstacles.

column4: UPDATE 1-Lockheed expects positive Pentagon view on Sikorsky buy
column5: WASHINGTON  July 20 Lockheed Martin Corp  on Monday said Pentagon officials planned a detailed review of the company's bid to acquire Sikorsky Aircraft  the helicopter unit of United Technologies Corp  but it did not expect major obstacles.

column4: Lockheed CFO sees Sikorsky turnaround around late 2018 or 2019
column5: WASHINGTON Sikorsky Aircraft will face some revenues and earnings pressures for several years  but should see improved market conditions in the commercial sector and growth in new military production around late 2018 or 2019  Lockheed Martin Corp's chief financial officer said on Monday.

column4: With Sikorsky sale done  United Technologies eyes acquisitions
column5: Now that United Technologies Corp Chief Executive Greg Hayes has closed a deal to sell the conglomerate's Sikorsky helicopter unit  he may become an acquirer in his own right.

column4: UPDATE 2-PayPal returns to market with $52 bln valuation
column5: July 20 PayPal Holdings Inc shares jumped as much as 11 percent in their highly anticipated return to the Nasdaq after more than a decade in eBay Inc's  fold  valuing the digital payment processor at about $52 billion.

column4: PayPal valued at about $50 bln ahead of market debut
column5: July 20 PayPal Holdings Inc shares rose 5.9 percent in premarket trading  ahead of their highly anticipated return to the Nasdaq  valuing the company at about $50 billion.

column4: UPDATE 3-SunEdison buys Vivint for $2.2 bln to expand residential business
column5: July 20 SunEdison Inc agreed to buy Vivint Solar Inc  the second-biggest U.S. solar panel installer  in a deal valued at about $2.2 billion  speeding up its expansion in the booming residential solar market.

column4: SunEdison  unit to buy Vivint Solar for about $2.2 bln
column5: July 20 SunEdison Inc and its unit TerraForm Power Inc said they would acquire Vivint Solar Inc in a deal valued at about $2.2 billion.
